body_html:
@MlWoo the code was merged. You now have two points of entry:

  1. One given a tensor of parameters
  2. One given a single parameter.

The CUDA branches are the same as before with the same issues as you mention, so we'll have someone look at that as well. However, for CPU only you should be good to go.
body_text:
@MlWoo the code was merged. You now have two points of entry:

One given a tensor of parameters
One given a single parameter.

The CUDA branches are the same as before with the same issues as you mention, so we'll have someone look at that as well. However, for CPU only you should be good to go.
body:
@MlWoo the code was merged. You now have two points of entry:

1) One [given a tensor of parameters](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/Distributions.cpp#L132)
2) One [given a single parameter](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/Distributions.cpp#L149).

The CUDA branches are the same as before with the same issues as you mention, so we'll have someone look at that as well. However, for CPU only you should be good to go.
